Premium Services

Design & Permitting

We navigate the council red tape so you don't have to.

When Do You Need a Permit?

In Victoria, building regulations are strict. You generally need a building permit if:
  • The wall is over 1 meter in height.
  • The wall is within 1 meter of a boundary line.
  • The wall supports a surcharge load (e.g., a driveway, building, or another wall above it).
constructing without a permit can lead to council fines and orders to demolish.

Our Design Service

We provide a turnkey solution.
  • Site Survey: Measuring levels and boundaries.
  • Structural Engineering: Computations for post spacing, footing depth, and steel size types to ensure compliance.
  • Drafting: producing working drawings for the builder and council.

The Approval Process

Dealing with councils like Monash, Knox, Whitehorse, and Casey can be time-consuming. We act as your agent, submitting all documents to the building surveyor, responding to RFIs (Requests for Information), and securing the Building Permit so construction can legally commence.
